thread.title_full: Panama formulates new, easier visa policy for CubansTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Panama formulates new, easier visa policy for CubansTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Panama formulates new, easier visa policy for Cubans
Facilitating commutation between Cuba and Panama, a faster method for extending visas to Cuban citizens wanting to enter Panama, was put in force Friday.
According to an Executive Decree signed by President Juan Carlos Varela, visas can be extended for up to three years of multiple entries and exits from Panamanian territory and will be decided by its Consul in Havana.
The decision was advanced by the Panama President Juan Carlos Varela during his recent visit to Cuba.
This change will be extended too to nationals of the Dominican Republic and will facilitate tourist trips or those of passengers coming from both nations, assured Varela in dialogue with journalists.
The Government of Panama eliminates the procedure standing until now, consisting in the revisi√≥n by the National Security Council (CSN) of each Cuban citizen applying for entry to the Central American nation, process that usually lasted several months.
